trans-unit.source: Shared Access Signature Authentication with Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Shared Access Signature Authentication with Service Bus

trans-unit.source: Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication allows applications to authenticate to <token>sb1</token> using an access key configured on the namespace, or on the entity with which specific rights are associated.
trans-unit.target: Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication allows applications to authenticate to <token>sb1</token> using an access key configured on the namespace, or on the entity with which specific rights are associated.

trans-unit.source: You can then use this key to generate a SAS token that clients can use to authenticate to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can then use this key to generate a SAS token that clients can use to authenticate to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication in <token>sb2</token> involves the configuration of a cryptographic key with associated rights on a <token>sb2</token> resource.
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication in <token>sb2</token> involves the configuration of a cryptographic key with associated rights on a <token>sb2</token> resource.

trans-unit.source: Clients claim access to <token>sb2</token> resources by presenting a SAS token.
trans-unit.target: Clients claim access to <token>sb2</token> resources by presenting a SAS token.

trans-unit.source: This token consists of the resource URI being accessed, and an expiry signed with the configured key.
trans-unit.target: This token consists of the resource URI being accessed, and an expiry signed with the configured key.

trans-unit.source: You can configure Shared Access Signature authorization rules on <token>sb2</token> relays, queues, topics, and Event Hubs.
trans-unit.target: You can configure Shared Access Signature authorization rules on <token>sb2</token> relays, queues, topics, and Event Hubs.

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication uses the following elements:
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication uses the following elements:

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>: A 256-bit primary cryptographic key in Base64 representation, an optional secondary key, and a key name and associated rights (a collection of Listen, Send, or Manage rights).
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>: A 256-bit primary cryptographic key in Base64 representation, an optional secondary key, and a key name and associated rights (a collection of Listen, Send, or Manage rights).

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedAccessSignatureTokenProvider.SharedAccessSignature</codeEntityReference> token: Generated using the HMAC-SHA256 of a resource string, consisting of the URI of the resource that is accessed and an expiry, with the cryptographic key.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedAccessSignatureTokenProvider.SharedAccessSignature</codeEntityReference> token: Generated using the HMAC-SHA256 of a resource string, consisting of the URI of the resource that is accessed and an expiry, with the cryptographic key.

trans-unit.source: The signature and other elements described in the following sections are formatted into a string to form the <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedAccessSignatureTokenProvider.SharedAccessSignature</codeEntityReference> token.
trans-unit.target: The signature and other elements described in the following sections are formatted into a string to form the <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedAccessSignatureTokenProvider.SharedAccessSignature</codeEntityReference> token.

trans-unit.source: Configuration for Shared Access Signature Authentication
trans-unit.target: Configuration for Shared Access Signature Authentication

trans-unit.source: You can configure the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> rule on <token>sb2</token> namespaces, queues, topics, or notification hubs.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> rule on <token>sb2</token> namespaces, queues, topics, or notification hubs.

trans-unit.source: Configuring a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> on a <token>sb2</token> subscription is currently not supported, but you can use rules configured on a namespace or topic to secure access to subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Configuring a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> on a <token>sb2</token> subscription is currently not supported, but you can use rules configured on a namespace or topic to secure access to subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: For a working sample that illustrates this procedure, see the <externalLink><linkText>Using Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication with Service Bus Subscriptions</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazure/Using-Shared-Access-e605b37c</linkUri></externalLink> sample.
trans-unit.target: For a working sample that illustrates this procedure, see the <externalLink><linkText>Using Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication with Service Bus Subscriptions</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazure/Using-Shared-Access-e605b37c</linkUri></externalLink> sample.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 12 such rules can be configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace, queue, topic, or notification hub.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 12 such rules can be configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace, queue, topic, or notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Rules that are configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace apply to all entities in that namespace.
trans-unit.target: Rules that are configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace apply to all entities in that namespace.

trans-unit.source: In this figure, the <legacyItalic>manageRuleNS</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>sendRuleNS</legacyItalic>, and <legacyItalic>listenRuleNS</legacyItalic> authorization rules apply to both queue Q1 and topic T1, while <legacyItalic>listenRuleQ</legacyItalic> and <legacyItalic>sendRuleQ</legacyItalic> apply to only queue Q1 and <legacyItalic>sendRuleT</legacyItalic> applies only to topic T1.
trans-unit.target: In this figure, the <legacyItalic>manageRuleNS</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>sendRuleNS</legacyItalic>, and <legacyItalic>listenRuleNS</legacyItalic> authorization rules apply to both queue Q1 and topic T1, while <legacyItalic>listenRuleQ</legacyItalic> and <legacyItalic>sendRuleQ</legacyItalic> apply to only queue Q1 and <legacyItalic>sendRuleT</legacyItalic> applies only to topic T1.

trans-unit.source: The key parameters of a <embeddedLabel>SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</embeddedLabel> are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The key parameters of a <embeddedLabel>SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</embeddedLabel> are as follows:

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: KeyName
trans-unit.target: KeyName

trans-unit.source: A string that describes the authorization rule.
trans-unit.target: A string that describes the authorization rule.

trans-unit.source: PrimaryKey
trans-unit.target: PrimaryKey

trans-unit.source: A base64-encoded 256-bit primary key for signing and validating the SAS token.
trans-unit.target: A base64-encoded 256-bit primary key for signing and validating the SAS token.

trans-unit.source: SecondaryKey
trans-unit.target: SecondaryKey

trans-unit.source: A base64-encoded 256-bit secondary key for signing and validating the SAS token.
trans-unit.target: A base64-encoded 256-bit secondary key for signing and validating the SAS token.

trans-unit.source: AccessRights
trans-unit.target: AccessRights

trans-unit.source: A list of access rights granted by the authorization rule.
trans-unit.target: A list of access rights granted by the authorization rule.

trans-unit.source: These rights can be any collection of Listen, Send, and Manage rights.
trans-unit.target: These rights can be any collection of Listen, Send, and Manage rights.

trans-unit.source: When a <token>sb2</token> namespace is provisioned, a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>, with <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.KeyName</codeEntityReference> set to <embeddedLabel>RootManageSharedAccessKey</embeddedLabel>, is created by default.
trans-unit.target: When a <token>sb2</token> namespace is provisioned, a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>, with <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.KeyName</codeEntityReference> set to <embeddedLabel>RootManageSharedAccessKey</embeddedLabel>, is created by default.

trans-unit.source: Two default <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> objects are also configured for notification hubs: one with Listen, Send, and Manage rights, and another with only Listen rights.
trans-unit.target: Two default <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> objects are also configured for notification hubs: one with Listen, Send, and Manage rights, and another with only Listen rights.

trans-unit.source: Regenerating and Revoking keys for Shared Access Authorization Rules
trans-unit.target: Regenerating and Revoking keys for Shared Access Authorization Rules

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you periodically regenerate the keys used in the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you periodically regenerate the keys used in the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Applications should generally use the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.PrimaryKey</codeEntityReference> to generate a SAS token.
trans-unit.target: Applications should generally use the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.PrimaryKey</codeEntityReference> to generate a SAS token.

trans-unit.source: When regenerating the keys, you should replace the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.SecondaryKey</codeEntityReference> with the old primary key, and generate a new key as the new primary key.
trans-unit.target: When regenerating the keys, you should replace the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.SecondaryKey</codeEntityReference> with the old primary key, and generate a new key as the new primary key.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to continue using tokens for authorization that were issued with the old primary key, and that have not yet expired.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to continue using tokens for authorization that were issued with the old primary key, and that have not yet expired.

trans-unit.source: If a key is compromised and you have to revoke the keys, you can regenerate both the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.PrimaryKey</codeEntityReference> and the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.SecondaryKey</codeEntityReference> of a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>, replacing them with new keys.
trans-unit.target: If a key is compromised and you have to revoke the keys, you can regenerate both the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.PrimaryKey</codeEntityReference> and the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.SecondaryKey</codeEntityReference> of a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>, replacing them with new keys.

trans-unit.source: This procedure invalidates all tokens signed with the old keys.
trans-unit.target: This procedure invalidates all tokens signed with the old keys.

trans-unit.source: Generating a Shared Access Signature token
trans-unit.target: Generating a Shared Access Signature token

trans-unit.source: Any client that has access to the signing keys specified in the shared access authorization rule can generate the SAS token.
trans-unit.target: Any client that has access to the signing keys specified in the shared access authorization rule can generate the SAS token.

trans-unit.source: It is formatted as follows:
trans-unit.target: It is formatted as follows:

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>signature</legacyBold> for the SAS token is computed using the HMAC-SHA256 of a string-to-sign with the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.PrimaryKey</codeEntityReference> property of an authorization rule.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>signature</legacyBold> for the SAS token is computed using the HMAC-SHA256 of a string-to-sign with the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.PrimaryKey</codeEntityReference> property of an authorization rule.

trans-unit.source: The string-to-sign consists of a resource URI and an expiry, formatted as follows:
trans-unit.target: The string-to-sign consists of a resource URI and an expiry, formatted as follows:

trans-unit.source: Note that you should use the encoded resource URI for this operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that you should use the encoded resource URI for this operation.

trans-unit.source: The resource URI is the full URI of the <token>sb2</token> resource to which access is claimed.
trans-unit.target: The resource URI is the full URI of the <token>sb2</token> resource to which access is claimed.

trans-unit.source: For example, <codeInline>http://%%amp;lt;namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/%%amp;lt;entityPath%%amp;gt;</codeInline> or <codeInline>sb://%%amp;lt;namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/%%amp;lt;entityPath%%amp;gt;</codeInline>; that is, <codeInline>http://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/contosoTopics/T1/Subscriptions/S3</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For example, <codeInline>http://%%amp;lt;namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/%%amp;lt;entityPath%%amp;gt;</codeInline> or <codeInline>sb://%%amp;lt;namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/%%amp;lt;entityPath%%amp;gt;</codeInline>; that is, <codeInline>http://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/contosoTopics/T1/Subscriptions/S3</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The expiry is represented as the number of seconds since the epoch 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970.
trans-unit.target: The expiry is represented as the number of seconds since the epoch 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970.

trans-unit.source: The shared access authorization rule used for signing must be configured on the entity specified by this URI, or one of its hierarchical parents.
trans-unit.target: The shared access authorization rule used for signing must be configured on the entity specified by this URI, or one of its hierarchical parents.

trans-unit.source: For example, <codeInline>http://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/contosoTopics/T1</codeInline> or <codeInline>http://contoso.servicebus.windows.net</codeInline> in the previous example.)
trans-unit.target: For example, <codeInline>http://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/contosoTopics/T1</codeInline> or <codeInline>http://contoso.servicebus.windows.net</codeInline> in the previous example.)

trans-unit.source: A SAS token is valid for all resources under the <resourceURI> used in the string-to-sign.
trans-unit.target: A SAS token is valid for all resources under the <resourceURI> used in the string-to-sign.

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.KeyName</codeEntityReference> in the SAS token refers to the <embeddedLabel>keyName</embeddedLabel> of the shared access authorization rule used to generate the token.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule.KeyName</codeEntityReference> in the SAS token refers to the <embeddedLabel>keyName</embeddedLabel> of the shared access authorization rule used to generate the token.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyItalic>URL-encoded-resourceURI</legacyItalic> must be the same as the URI used in the string-to-sign during the computation of the signature.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyItalic>URL-encoded-resourceURI</legacyItalic> must be the same as the URI used in the string-to-sign during the computation of the signature.

trans-unit.source: It should be <externalLink><linkText>percent-encoded</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4fkewx0t.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: It should be <externalLink><linkText>percent-encoded</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4fkewx0t.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Using Shared Access Signature authentication
trans-unit.target: Using Shared Access Signature authentication

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication support is included in the Azure SDK version 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication support is included in the Azure SDK version 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="f9837e0a-0922-4521-9300-ca962abb1ff6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to use Shared Access Signature Authentication with Service Bus</link>.
